raw_text:
Slim PlayStation triples sales
 
 Sony PlayStation 2's slimmer shape has proved popular with UK gamers, with 50,000 sold in its first week on sale.
 
 Sales have tripled since launch, outstripping Microsoft's Xbox, said market analysts Chart-Track. The numbers were also boosted by the release of the PS2-only game Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas. The title broke the UK sales record for video games in its first weekend of release. Latest figures suggest it has sold more than 677,000 copies.
 
 "It is obviously very, very encouraging for Sony because Microsoft briefly outsold them last week," John Houlihan, editor of Computerandvideogames.com told BBC News. "And with Halo 2 [for Xbox] out next week, it really is a head-to-head contest between them and Xbox."
 
 Although Xbox sales over the last week also climbed, PS2 sales were more than double that. The figures mean Sony is reaching the seven million barrier for UK sales of the console. Edinburgh-based developer, Rockstar, which is behind the GTA titles, has seen San Andreas pull in an estimated £24m in gross revenues over the weekend. In comparison, blockbuster films like Harry Potter and The Prisoner Of Azkaban took £11.5m in its first three days at the UK box office. The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King took nearly £10m over its opening weekend, although games titles are four to five times more expensive than cinema tickets.
 
 Gangster-themed GTA San Andreas is the sequel to Grand Theft Auto Vice City which previously held the record for the fastest-selling video game ever. The Xbox game Halo 2, released on 11 November in the UK, is also widely tipped to be one of the best-selling games of the year. The original title won universal acclaim in 2001, and sold more than four million copies.
 
 Mr Houlihan added that Sony had done well with the PS2, but it definitely helped that the release of San Andreas coincided with the slimline PS2 hitting the shelves. The run-up to Christmas is a huge battlefield for games consoles and titles. Microsoft's Xbox had been winning the race up until last week in sales. The sales figures also suggest that it may be a largely adult audience driving demand, since GTA San Andreas has an 18 certificate. Sony and Microsoft have both reduced console prices recently and are preparing the way for the launches of their next generation consoles in 2005. "Both have hit crucial price points at around £100 and that really does open up new consoles to new audience, plus the release of two really important games in terms of development are also driving those sales," said Mr Houlihan.
llama3.2:1b: Sony's PlayStation 2 has sold over 50,000 copies in its first week on sale in the UK, tripling its sales since launch and outstripping Microsoft's Xbox in this regard. The PS2 game Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas also broke the UK sales record for video games in its first weekend of release, selling more than 677,000 copies. These figures have boosted Sony's confidence, with editor John Houlihan stating that it is "obviously very encouraging" for the company.
llama3.2:3b: Sony PlayStation 2's slimmer model has sold over 50,000 units in its first week, with overall sales tripling since launch. The console is outselling Microsoft's Xbox and breaking records for video game sales in the UK. The release of Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas has contributed to this success, selling over 677,000 copies and generating £24m in gross revenues over the weekend.
gemma2:2b: The PlayStation 2 has tripled its sales since launch, outselling Xbox in the UK and surpassing record-breaking sales for Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas. The game's popularity, combined with the release of a slimmer PS2 model, contributed to Sony's strong performance.  Sales are nearing seven million units in the UK, surpassing even the success of blockbuster films. The next generation consoles from both Sony and Microsoft are expected to be launched in 2005, following these successful releases.
qwen2.5:0.5b:
Here is the summary:

- PlayStation 2 sold less than 50,000 units initially.
- It tripled its sales during its first week, surpassing Xbox.
- Microsoft's Xbox had more games in its top sales list this year.
- PS2's performance has been particularly good this year, breaking its record for sales.
- GTA San Andreas grossed over £1 billion in the UK and is expected to be a blockbuster game.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Sony's Slim PlayStation 2 outsold rivals Xbox with over 50,000 sales in its first week, spurred by Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas, which broke UK video game sales records. San Andreas generated £24m in gross revenues and has sold more than 677,000 copies. Microsoft's Halo 2 is also tipped to be a best-selling title this year. The slim PlayStation 2's release coincided with the Xbox's launch week, indicating an adult audience driving demand. Both companies have been reducing console prices in preparation for upcoming next-generation consoles.
qwen2.5:3b: Sony PlayStation 2's slimmer shape has boosted its sales significantly, tripling since launch according to market analysts Chart-Track. It sold 50,000 units in its first week and surpassed Xbox, notably aided by the release of Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas, which broke UK sales records with over 677,000 copies sold. The game also generated £24m in gross revenues. Sony has now reached seven million PS2 consoles sold in the UK. Sales figures suggest this popularity is mainly driven by adult audiences interested in GTA San Andreas' 18 certificate content. With upcoming Xbox game Halo 2 and the slimline PS2, both console manufacturers are aiming for new audience segments with reduced prices for their next-gen consoles set to launch in 2005.
opencoder:1.5b: Slim PlayStation triples sales, with sales increasing since launch, outstripping Xbox, market analysts Chart-Track report, and it also has tripled since launch. It breaks the UK sales record for video games in its first weekend of release with latest figures suggesting it has sold more than 677,000 copies. The console is expected to reach the seven million barrier for UK sales before it was previously said to have been slow selling. The console's developer, Rockstar, which is behind the GTA titles, has seen San Andreas pull in a significant amount of money in gross revenues over the weekend. The release of San Andreas coincided with the slimline PS2 hitting the shelves and Xbox had been winning the race up until last week in sales. The figures also suggest that it may be a largely adult audience driving demand.

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Alright, I need to summarize this text about PlayStation 2 sales and how it's impacting game titles like GTA San Andreas. Let me read through each point carefully.

First, the PS2 has a slimmer shape, which is popular in the UK, selling 50,000 units first week. Sales tripled since launch, more than tripling compared to Microsoft's Xbox. It's on the top of UK video game sales for games that weekend. Other factors include Halo 2 and the GTA series with a £24m gross. Gangster-themed GTA San Andreas is the sequel to Vice City, which was first fastesteller. Rockstar made £24m in the UK alone. Xbox had sales around half of Sony's. Games titles are more expensive than films but better for consoles. Christmas rush is big for games; Microsoft's sales led last week. Both companies reduced prices and prepare for next-gen consoles.

I should focus on key points: PS2's success, its tripling in sales, GTA San Andreas's sales numbers, GTA being a sequel, the racing between Sony and Xbox, and how it affects console sales. Make sure to include all these elements concisely.
</think>

The PlayStation 2 has seen 50,000 first-week sales in the UK, with sales tripling since launch, surpassing Microsoft's Xbox. GTA San Andreas sold over £677,000, breaking the UK video game sales record for games that weekend. It was the sequel to Vice City, which held the fastest-selling title record. Rockstar grossed £24m from GTA San Andreas alone, while films like Harry Potter & The Prisoner of Azkaban and Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King took £11.5m and £10m respectively in its first three days at the UK box office. Both Sony and Xbox saw sales around half, with Microsoft's sales leading last week, hinting at a future rivalry between them and Xbox. Christmas rush boosts game demand, and both companies reduced prices, preparing for next-gen releases.
tinyllama:1.1b: Aiming for over seven million sales, Sony PlayStation 2's triple-selling game, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas, outshone Microsoft's Xbox and hit a record UK sales figure, selling more than 677,000 copies in its first weekend of release. The latest figures suggest that Sony has performed well with the PS2 thanks to its successful release of Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas along with the concurrent Xbox title, Hallo-2. While games console sales have been affected by Christmas shopping, it is likely that older titles such as Rockstar's latest installment, Grand Theft Auto: Vice City, have contributed to Sony's success with the PS2. As 2005 approaches, Sony and Microsoft are preparing for the launches of their next generation consoles, which could see an increased audience driving demand.
tinydolphin:1.1b:
The PlayStation 2 (PS2) was a slimmer version of its predecessor, the original PlayStation (PS1), which was known for its distinctive design and had sold over 50 million units worldwide by its launch in 1994. In the UK, Sony's slimmed-down console has been outperforming Microsoft's Xbox in sales figures since its release last month.

Sales have tripled since the launch of the PS2 and its latest blockbuster game Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas broke the UK records for video games, with over 677,000 copies sold by its first weekend. Latest figures show it has sold more than 1 million copies in the United States alone.

The success of the PS2 is also a reflection of its launch on November 11, which coincided with the release of Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas. This allowed the title to reach the shelves just as Xbox's slimmed-down model, the Xbox, was being introduced to the UK market.

Microsoft's Xbox had been winning the race up until last week in sales figures, with its launch on November 15 receiving positive reviews and an estimated £24 million in gross revenues over the weekend. However, this decline has been offset by a strong debut for the slimmer PlayStation 2, which managed to outsell Microsoft's competitor.

The increased demand for smaller consoles might be driving consumers to purchase more games and entertainment content, particularly from established developers like Rockstar and its GTA series. This could lead to more demand for the next-generation console and could also encourage retailers and game developers to release games more competitively priced than they would have been in previous years.

The increased competition between Sony's PlayStation 2 and Microsoft's Xbox is a sign of how crucial launches can be for success in the gaming industry, as both companies are preparing their next-generation consoles for release in 2005.

Although Xbox sales also increased last week, PS2 sales were more than double that. This means Sony is reaching the seven million barrier for UK sales of the console, while game titles are four to five times more expensive than cinema tickets. Gangster-themed GTA San Andreas is the sequel to Grand Theft Auto Vice City and has been widely tipped to be one of the best-selling games of the year.

stablelm2:1.6b: Slim PlayStation triples UK gaming sales: Sony's PlayStation 2 with a slimmer shape has become popular among UK gamers, selling in its first week. granite3.1-dense:2b:
Sony's slimmed-down PlayStation 2 (PS2) has significantly boosted its UK sales, tripling since launch and surpassing Microsoft's Xbox. In the first week following its release, 50,000 units were sold, with figures reaching over 677,000 after the launch of Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas (GTA: San Andreas). This game set a new UK sales record for video games in its opening weekend, generating an estimated £24m in gross revenues. The PS2 has now reached seven million units sold in the UK.

Market analysts credit the success to both the sleek design and the release of GTA: San Andreas, a game with an 18 certificate indicating it's targeted at adults. The strong performance of these products contrasted Microsoft's Xbox, which saw its sales numbers slightly increase but remain behind Sony's.

This sales boost coincides with upcoming competitive launches from both companies in 2005—Sony's next-generation console and Microsoft's enhanced version. Price reductions for both systems have made them more accessible to a broader audience, including those previously uninterested in gaming. Meanwhile, the release of GTA: San Andreas further underscores the potential of adult-oriented video games as key drivers of demand.
reference: The title broke the UK sales record for video games in its first weekend of release.Although Xbox sales over the last week also climbed, PS2 sales were more than double that.Sony PlayStation 2's slimmer shape has proved popular with UK gamers, with 50,000 sold in its first week on sale.The sales figures also suggest that it may be a largely adult audience driving demand, since GTA San Andreas has an 18 certificate.The Xbox game Halo 2, released on 11 November in the UK, is also widely tipped to be one of the best-selling games of the year.The numbers were also boosted by the release of the PS2-only game Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas.The figures mean Sony is reaching the seven million barrier for UK sales of the console."Both have hit crucial price points at around £100 and that really does open up new consoles to new audience, plus the release of two really important games in terms of development are also driving those sales," said Mr Houlihan.Microsoft's Xbox had been winning the race up until last week in sales.
